conclusion: Analyze flow patterns and positions of outlets A, B, C, D relative to baffles E and F.
Outlet A is indicated by a red arrow.
Outlet B is indicated by a red arrow.
Outlet C is indicated by a red arrow.
Outlet D is indicated by a red arrow.
Baffles E and F are indicated by red arrows.
Outlet A is located at the top of the image.
Outlet B is located at the top of the image.
Outlet C is located at the top of the image.
Outlet D is located at the top of the image.
Outlets A, B, C, and D are at the top, and baffles E and F are at the bottom, so liquid will flow from outlets to baffles.
Liquid will flow from outlets A, B, C, and D into baffles E and F.
Liquid will flow into container E after passing through the baffles.
